dish_description: The dish is a gratin of eggs, which includes sliced hard-boiled eggs layered with a homemade bechamel cream sauce, garnished with mushrooms, corn, mozzarella cheese, ham, and topped with Parmesan cheese, then broiled to perfection.

cooking_steps.description: Start by making a roux with a tablespoon of butter and a tablespoon of flour, cooking it for about 20 to 30 seconds.
Gradually add a cup of cold milk to the roux while whisking, and season with a dash of salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil to thicken it into a cream sauce.
Prepare hard-boiled eggs by boiling them for 9 to 10 minutes, then cooling them in ice or cold water to prevent a green tinge around the yolks.
Peel the eggs, ideally under running water to make it easier to remove the shell and the second skin.
Slice the peeled eggs and arrange them in a dish suitable for gratin. Five eggs are recommended for serving two people.
Prepare the garnish by slicing mushrooms and adding them to the cream sauce. Bring the sauce back to a boil and then add about a quarter cup of cream.
Add a third of a cup of mozzarella cheese, some corn, and two small slices of ham to the dish as additional garnish.

Pour the cream sauce over the eggs, ensuring it seeps in between. Sprinkle the top with cracked pepper, chives, and a teaspoon or so of Parmesan cheese. Broil the gratin for a few minutes until it's golden and bubbly.
